mnemonic: NÃO sounds like 'now' with a nasal - NOW NO!
grammar_notes: Place before verb to negate. Double negatives are correct in Portuguese!
cultural_note: Portuguese uses double negatives: 'não quero nada' is correct not redundant!
tip: Nasal sound - place before verb to negate

mnemonic: NUNCA = NOON-kah - I've NEVER seen noon!
grammar_notes: Often combined with não for emphasis. 'Nunca mais' = never again.
cultural_note: 'Nunca digas nunca' (never say never) - Portuguese love this phrase!
tip: Stronger than não - often used with não

mnemonic: NADA = NAH-DAH - like saying 'nah duh' nothing special!
grammar_notes: Often used with não: 'não quero nada'. Can stand alone.
cultural_note: 'De nada' (you're welcome - literally 'of nothing') - very common response!
tip: Can be used alone or with não

grammar_notes: Used with não: 'Não vi ninguém' (I didn't see anyone).
cultural_note: 'Ninguém é perfeito' (nobody is perfect) - common saying!
tip: Nasal sound at start - often with não

grammar_notes: Masculine form. Agrees with noun: nenhum livro (no book).
cultural_note: 'Nenhum problema!' is the cool way to say 'no problem!'

mnemonic: NENHUMA ends in A - feminine none!
cultural_note: 'Sem nenhuma razão' (without any reason) - dramatic expression!

mnemonic: NEM sounds like NAME - neither NAME applies!
cultural_note: 'Nem pensar!' (don't even think about it!) - emphatic refusal.

mnemonic: JÁ NÃO = 'YEAH NO' - yeah we're NOT doing that anymore!
grammar_notes: Indicates change from past. 'Já' adds temporal element.
cultural_note: Common in breakups: 'Já não te amo' (I no longer love you) - dramatic!

mnemonic: AINDA NÃO = 'ah-IN-da NO' - India? NO not YET!
grammar_notes: Implies expectation of future change. Temporary state.
cultural_note: Patient Portuguese say 'ainda não' a lot - things happen eventually!

grammar_notes: Tag question seeking agreement. Can go at end of statements.
cultural_note: Portuguese love confirmation - 'não é?' is everywhere in conversation!
